poem:
**Moana's Voyage**

In endless waves of screens she sails,  
a voyager in pixelled seas,  
where once upon ancestral trails,  
the lore of islands rides the breeze.  
  
A billion voices sing along,  
reflections of her ancient song.  
Oceans may rise and islands part,  
yet Moana finds her course by heart.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "How far she went: why did the Moana films become such a phenomenon? If you want a quick explanation of why Moana 2 is on target to gross more than a billion dollars worldwide (it’s already made $400m in less than a week), you need only to look back to 2023, when the original Moana – a seven-year-old movie at the time – topped the list of the most-streamed movies in the United States. The". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
